article.description:
The frustrations of the top two power
forwards in the Western Conference came to a head at the same
time.
article.headline: Spurs get back on track at home
article.linkText: Garnett, Duncan ejected as Spurs rock T-Wolves
article.story:
SAN ANTONIO (AP) -- The San Antonio Spurs didn't need star forward Tim Duncan to beat the Minnesota Timberwolves.
Duncan

Garnett

David Robinson had 13 points and 15 rebounds and seven San Antonio players scored in double figures as the Spurs beat Minnesota 113-83 Monday night. The Spurs, who snapped a four-game home losing streak, played most of the second half without Duncan, who was ejected along with Minnesota's Kevin Garnett early in the third quarter. Duncan was ejected for the first time in his four-year NBA career after a brief verbal exchange with Garnett with 9:49 remaining in the third quarter and San Antonio leading 60-33. "We knew we had to get some good execution from the rest of us, especially when you lose your marquee player," said reserve forward Malik Rose, who had 12 points and nine rebounds. Minnesota coach Flip Saunders didn't blame the loss on Garnett's ejection. "This game was decided in the first three minutes," Saunders said. "They came out aggressive and jumped all over us and we never responded in a positive way." San Antonio coach Gregg Popovich praised his team, giving much of the credit to Robinson for stepping up after Duncan was ejected. "David was great defensively and rebounding-wise," Popovich said. "He was a force." Prior to the ejection of the Duncan and Garnett, Minnesota had scored just 19 points in the previous 19 minutes. The Timberwolves went on to outscore the Spurs 25-17 through the rest of the quarter, closing within 77-58 after three periods. Duncan and Antonio Daniels each scored 13 points for the Spurs. Duncan also had nine rebounds before being ejected. Reserve Gary Trent led Minnesota with 16 points. Joe Smith, Wally Szczerbiak and Chauncey Billups each scored 10 points for the Timberwolves. Garnett had eight points and six rebounds before being ejected. Minnesota, limited to 18 points in the first quarter, scored a season-low 11 points in the second as San Antonio pushed its lead to 56-29 by the break. At 9:49 in the third, referee Luis Grillo called a technical on Garnett after he started yelling at Duncan during some rough play under the Spurs' basket. Duncan smiled and was walking away, but he then turned and said something to Garnett. Grillo hit him with a technical and ejected both players. There was no physical contact between the players. Game notes
The victory was San Antonio's 23rd in 28 games against Minnesota in the Alamodome. ... Minnesota's Terrell Brandon had been questionable with a knee injury after leaving Sunday's game against Sacramento. Brandon started and played 13 minutes. ... Monday's game was the 1,000th in the Timberwolves' franchise history. Minnesota is 391-609 overall.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
